text: KADUNA, Nigeria, March 12 Around 30 students are missing after gunmen attacked a college in the northwest Nigerian state of Kaduna, the states security commissioner said on Friday.Samuel Aruwan, in a statement, said an armed gang attacked the Federal College of Forestry Mechanization at around 11:30 p.m. on Thursday. He said the Nigerian army rescued 180 people in the early hours of Friday but about 30 students, a mix of males and females, are yet to be accounted for. (Reporting by Garba Muhammad in Kaduna; Writing by Alexis Akwagyiram; Editing by Alex Richardson)
